document_data.name: Honeyed Bun
document_data.mainbody: '''Honeyed buns''' were a type of local [[bread]] dish from the city of [[Arrabar]] in the [[Vilhon Reach]].
document_data.Description: Honeyed buns were small-in-size handfoods covered in sweet [[honey]], making them a cheap treat and popular morningfeast among the common folk of Arrabar.
document_data.History: ''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1373}}, blind aging commoner [[Nimra Skolotti]] and her young daughter [[Mirolyn Skolotti]] liked to start their day with a single fresh honeyed bun from a local bakery in the Living District they loved in. A simple pleasure, the women split a bun as they took care of daily chores.
